summaryText: What an incredible Mother's Day message from Pastor Lee McFarland! This sermon was a powerful testament to the incredible love, sacrifice, and strength of mothers. Pastor Lee shared a hilarious opening story about three sons trying to gift their mom, which perfectly set the stage for a deeper exploration of motherhood. Drawing from biblical examples, he highlighted how mothers intercede, see potential in others, and serve selflessly. The most touching part of the sermon was undoubtedly Pastor Lee's personal story of adoption, where he and his wife Sandy experienced God's miraculous intervention. Their journey of waiting ten years to adopt their son Josh, and then miraculously discovering they were pregnant shortly after, was a powerful illustration of God's mysterious and perfect timing. Pastor Lee reminded us that greatness comes not from position or power, but from serving others - a lesson beautifully demonstrated by mothers everywhere. The message wasn't just about biological mothers, but about the spiritual mothering that happens in the church and in our relationships. Whether you're a mother, have a mother, or long to be a mother, this sermon offered hope, encouragement, and a profound reminder that God sees, knows, and cares about our deepest desires.
mainPoints: Intercede on your knees for a breakthrough
See potential in people around you
Learn that greatness comes by serving

versesMentioned.text: Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised. Honor her for all that her hands have done, and let her works bring her praise at the city gate.

Then the mother of Zebedee's sons came to Jesus with her sons and, kneeling down, asked a favor of him. 'What is it you want?' Jesus asked. She said, 'Grant that one of these two sons of mine may sit at your right and the other at your left in your kingdom.'
James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the name Boanerges, which means 'sons of thunder').
When the disciples James and John saw this, they asked, 'Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?'
To redeem those under the law, that we might receive adoption to sonship.

The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim freedom for the prisoners and recovery of sight for the blind, to set the oppressed free.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 139:13-14: 'For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing personal value and God's intentional design
Monday.action: Write a letter of gratitude to your mother or a maternal figure in your life, expressing specific ways they've positively impacted you.
Monday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for the gift of motherhood and for the special people You've placed in my life to nurture and love me. Help me appreciate the sacrifices made on my behalf and show gratitude. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 22:6: 'Start children off on the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it.'
Tuesday.focus: The power of spiritual guidance and mentorship
Tuesday.action: Identify someone in your life who needs encouragement. Reach out and speak words of life and potential over them.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, give me eyes to see the potential in others. Help me be an encourager and speak life into those around me. Show me how I can mentor or support someone in their journey. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Samuel 1:27-28: 'I prayed for this child, and the Lord has granted me what I asked of him. So now I give him to the Lord. For his whole life he will be given over to the Lord.'
Wednesday.action: Spend extended time in prayer, specifically interceding for your family, children (current or future), and loved ones.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my family and loved ones to You. Protect them, guide them, and use them for Your purposes. Help me be a consistent prayer warrior for those I love. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 6:4: 'Fathers, do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.'
Thursday.action: Reflect on how you can be more intentional in spiritual mentorship, whether with children, younger believers, or those you influence.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me be a positive influence in the lives of those around me. Give me wisdom to guide with love, patience, and biblical truth. Reveal areas where I can grow in mentorship. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ruth 1:16-17: 'Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay. Your people will be my people and your God my God.'
Friday.action: Reach out to someone who has been a spiritual mother or mentor in your life. Express your gratitude and reconnect.
Friday.prayer: Father, thank You for the spiritual mothers You've placed in my life. Help me honor and appreciate those who have guided me. Show me how to be a blessing to them. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 49:15-16: 'Can a mother forget the baby at her breast and have no compassion on the child she has borne? Though she may forget, I will not forget you! See, I have engraved you on the palms of my hands.'
Saturday.action: Spend time journaling about your personal journey, reflecting on how God has been faithful even when others might have forgotten or failed you.
Saturday.prayer: Loving Father, thank You that Your love is constant and Your memory of me is perfect. Help me rest in Your unfailing love and care. Remind me that I am precious to You. Amen.
